The Dow Jones Industrial Average is up more than 8%, almost 700 points. The spike comes after speculation that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates an additional .5% to an historic low 1%. This spike also comes after a report that single-family homes prices fell a record 16.6% from a year ago. Source: Truly Newsworthy, Truly Newsworthy - Breaking U.S., International, Political and Economic News.
 
 It is a shame this rebound isn't a result of specific economic factors, rather than just more governmental intervention.

Dow closes up 889.35 points to 9065.12. Source: Truly Newsworthy
 
 The Fed better come through tomorrow or watch this all disappear and then some.

Dow closes up 889.35 points to 9065.12. Source: Truly Newsworthy
 
 The Fed better come through tomorrow or watch this all disappear and then some.

 
 Why not be positive and say maybe, just maybe we have hit bottom in many areas and things will start to improve. Not in leaps and bounds, but slowly and surely.
 
 The next and hopefully last hurdle we have to overcome is Tuesday. It will be very telling and interesting to see the markets reaction to the election results.

The stock market going up that rapidly is just as bad as it going down rapidly.
 
 It is called instability and it is a sign that things are not good.

The stock market going up that rapidly is just as bad as it going down rapidly.
 
 It is called instability and it is a sign that things are not good.

 
 Actually volatility itself isn't necessary a bad thing. We know that smoothing was an attempt to eliminate that and thus influence stock prices. Small levels of volatility is rather minor.
 
 But you are right in that volatility in the sheer size we see today is a bad, bad, bad thing. Jumps and declines of 600+ points daily is frightening. Huge opportunities for profit taking though.

Is anyone else out there as outrages as I am that a goodly percentage of the bailout funds provided to the banks is going to either enable them to buy other banks or to bonuses to the execs who created the mess in the first place?emoticon_xkill
 
 The Gordon Geckos of America need to be kept on a very short leash.
